required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing Two Topicals in the Treatment of Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Evaluator-Blinded, Bilateral Comparison Study of Two Topicals in the Treatment of Subjects With Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: A Randomized, Evaluator-Blinded, Bilateral Comparison Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Two Topicals in the Treatment of Subjects With Acne Vulgaris (Study FX2018-23).

detailed_description.textblock: A Randomized, Evaluator-Blinded, Bilateral Comparison Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Two Topicals in the Treatment of Subjects With Acne Vulgaris. Eligible subjects will be randomized (1:1) to treatment with Test Article A to one side of the face versus Test Article B on the contralateral side.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Eligible subjects will be randomized (1:1) to treatment with Test Article A to one side of the face versus Test Article B on the contralateral side.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With 0 to 4 Investigator's Global Assessment Score at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: Severity of acne vulgaris was assessed by Investigator Global Assessment (IGA). The IGA score is a static evaluation of the overall severity or "average" degree of severity of a participant's disease by the Blinded Evaluator taking into account all of the participant's facial acne lesions as the participant appears on the day of the evaluation. Overall severity of acne was assessed using a five-point scale where 0=Clear, 1=Almost Clear, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, and 4=Severe. Low score represented best outcome and higher score value indicated worst outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Investigator's Global Assessments Treatment Success at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: Severity of acne vulgaris was assessed by IGA. The IGA score is a static evaluation of the overall severity or "average" degree of severity of a participant's disease by the Blinded Evaluator taking into account all of the participant's facial acne lesions as the participant appears on the day of the evaluation. Overall severity of acne was assessed using a five-point scale where 0=Clear, 1=Almost Clear, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, and 4=Severe. The IGA treatment "success" was defined as at least a two-point improvement in IGA score relative to Baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Inflammatory Lesion Count
primary_outcome.description: Inflammatory lesion count (ILC) included papules (raised inflammatory lesions with no visible purulent material) and pustules (raised inflammatory lesions with visible purulent material).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Inflammatory Lesion Count
primary_outcome.description: The ILC included papules (raised inflammatory lesions with no visible purulent material) and pustules (raised inflammatory lesions with visible purulent material).

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Non-Inflammatory Lesion Count
primary_outcome.description: The non-inflammatory lesion count (NILC) included open and closed comedones.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Non-Inflammatory Lesion Count
primary_outcome.description: The NILC included open and closed comedones.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Sebum Percentage Relative to Baseline Versus Weeks 2, 4, 6 and 7
primary_outcome.description: Sebum measurement was conducted on the right and left side of the face. The sebum measurement represented the sebum score of saturation of the film and had a range of 0 to 99, where 99 equated to very oily skin.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Transepidermal Water Loss Relative to Baseline Versus Weeks 2, 4, 6 and 7
primary_outcome.description: Transepidermal Water Loss (TEWL) was conducted on the right and left side of the face.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 until Week 7 (End of Study) and Unscheduled Visit
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in participants, whether or not considered drug related.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Having Local Skin Reactions With Improved/Same Versus Worsened Severities Compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 until Week 7 (End of Study) or Unscheduled Visit
primary_outcome.description: The local skin reactions (LSRs) included erythema, edema, scaling/dryness, burning/stinging, pruritus, erosion, and pain) were assessed. Erythema, edema, scaling/dryness, and erosion were assessed by the investigator and burning/stinging, pain, and pruritus were assessed by the participant. Assessments was made using a 4-point ordinal scale where 0=absent, 1=mild (slight, barely perceptible), 2=moderate (distinct presence), and 3=severe (marked, intense). Here, lower point represented no reaction and higher points represented severe reactions.The LSRs were assessed both before and 15 minutes following test article application.

arm_group.description: FMX101 hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A) topically applied daily for six weeks on one side of the face (in a split-face model)
Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B) topically applied daily for six weeks on the contralateral side of the face (in a split-face model)

intervention.description: FMX101 vehicle - hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A)
Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has facial acne vulgaris with:
16 inflammatory lesions (papules, pustules) The inflammatory lesion count on the right and left side of the face should be similar IGA score of moderate (3) on both the right and left side of the face
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acne conglobata, acne fulminans, secondary acne (chloracne, drug-induced acne), or any dermatological condition of the face or facial hair (eg, beard, sideburns, mustache) that could interfere with the clinical evaluations.
- More than two facial nodules/cysts
- Sunburn on the face

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study was conducted in one site at United States from November 20, 2018 to February 11, 2019.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study consisted of a Screening/Baseline Visit, Visits at Weeks 1, 2, and 4, along with a Week 6/End of Treatment (EOT) Visit, and a Week 7/End of Study (EOS) Visit. All participants underwent inclusion and exclusion criteria assessment and all eligible participants signed the informed consent before undergoing any study related procedures. All assessments at screening were done as per the schedule of assessment.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Participants were randomized (1:1) and applied FMX101 hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A) topically on one side of the face and Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B) on the contralateral side of the face once daily for six weeks.

baseline.population: Modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all randomized participants who met all Inclusion/Exclusion criteria, applied at least one dose of test article, and returned for at least one post-Baseline evaluation visit.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Participants were randomized (1:1) and applied FMX101 hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A) topically on one side of the face and Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B) on the contralateral side of the face once daily for six weeks on one side of the face.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants With 0 to 4 Investigator's Global Assessment Score at Week 6
outcome.description: Severity of acne vulgaris was assessed by Investigator Global Assessment (IGA). The IGA score is a static evaluation of the overall severity or "average" degree of severity of a participant's disease by the Blinded Evaluator taking into account all of the participant's facial acne lesions as the participant appears on the day of the evaluation. Overall severity of acne was assessed using a five-point scale where 0=Clear, 1=Almost Clear, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, and 4=Severe. Low score represented best outcome and higher score value indicated worst outcome.
outcome.population: The mITT population included all randomized participants who met all Inclusion/Exclusion criteria, applied at least one dose of test article, and returned for at least one post-Baseline evaluation visit. Here, overall number of participants analyzed presents only those participants who were analyzed for this particular outcome measure, and number analyzed presents the number of participants that were analyzed at specified week.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in participants, whether or not considered drug related.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 until Week 7 (End of Study) and Unscheduled Visit
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received test article and applied at least one application.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Participants were randomized (1:1) and applied FMX101 hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A) topically on one side of the face and Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B) on the contralateral side of the face once daily for six weeks.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Having Local Skin Reactions With Improved/Same Versus Worsened Severities Compared to Baseline
outcome.description: The local skin reactions (LSRs) included erythema, edema, scaling/dryness, burning/stinging, pruritus, erosion, and pain) were assessed. Erythema, edema, scaling/dryness, and erosion were assessed by the investigator and burning/stinging, pain, and pruritus were assessed by the participant. Assessments was made using a 4-point ordinal scale where 0=absent, 1=mild (slight, barely perceptible), 2=moderate (distinct presence), and 3=severe (marked, intense). Here, lower point represented no reaction and higher points represented severe reactions.The LSRs were assessed both before and 15 minutes following test article application.

outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received test article and applied at least one application. Here, overall number of participants analyzed presents only those participants who were analyzed for particular outcome measure, and number analyzed presents the number of participants that were analyzed at specified week.

reported_events.time_frame: Day 1 until Week 7 (End of Study) or Unscheduled Visit
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events were only monitored/assessed on the whole participant level.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Participants were randomized (1:1) and applied FMX101 hydrophobic oil based vehicle (Test Article A) topically on one side of the face and Hydro-alcohol solution based vehicle (Test Article B) on the contralateral side of the face once daily for six weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
